013package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
014
015import java.sql.Connection;
016import java.sql.DriverManager;
017import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
018import java.sql.ResultSet;
019import java.sql.SQLException;
020
021import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetHandle;
022import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
023import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
024
025/**
026 * Example implementing the {@code ResultSetHandle} interface, to return
027 * the {@link ResultSet} from any SQL {@code SELECT} query passed as a string
028 * to the {@link #executeSelect executeSelect} function.
029 *<p>
030 * This example relies on {@code implementor} tags reflecting the PostgreSQL
031 * version, set up in the {@link ConditionalDDR} example. Before PostgreSQL 8.4,
032 * there was no {@code =} or {@code DISTINCT FROM} operator between row types.
033 */
034@SQLAction(requires="selecttorecords fn", implementor="postgresql_ge_80400",
035install=
036" SELECT " +
037"  CASE WHEN r IS DISTINCT FROM ROW('Foo'::varchar, 1::integer, 1.5::float, " +
038"       23.67::decimal(8,2), '2005-06-01'::date, '20:56'::time, " +
039"       '192.168'::cidr) " +
040"  THEN javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'SetOfRecordTest not ok') " +
041"  ELSE javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'SetOfRecordTest ok') " +
042"  END " +
043" FROM " +
044"  javatest.executeselecttorecords( " +
045"   'select ''Foo'',  1,  1.5::float,  23.67,  ''2005-06-01'',  " +
046"           ''20:56''::time, ''192.168.0''') " +
047"  AS r(t_varchar varchar, t_integer integer, t_float float, " +
048"      t_decimal decimal(8,2), t_date date, t_time time, t_cidr cidr)"
049)
050public class SetOfRecordTest implements ResultSetHandle {
051
052    @Function(schema="javatest", name="executeselecttorecords",
053              provides="selecttorecords fn")
054    public static ResultSetHandle executeSelect(String selectSQL)
055            throws SQLException {
056        return new SetOfRecordTest(selectSQL);
057    }
058
059    private final PreparedStatement m_statement;
060
061    public SetOfRecordTest(String selectSQL) throws SQLException {
062        Connection conn = DriverManager
063                .getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
064        m_statement = conn.prepareStatement(selectSQL);
065    }
066
067    @Override
068    public void close() throws SQLException {
069        m_statement.close();
070    }
071
072    @Override
073    public ResultSet getResultSet() throws SQLException {
074        return m_statement.executeQuery();
075    }
076}
